dict.string: Which word has the same meaning as vapor?

array.string: From the ocean to the air|Y

dict.string: About how much of the Earth’s water is fresh?
About how much of an adult’s body is water?
On an especially dry and windy day, how quickly will evaporation probably happen?

array.string: At the same speed as usual|N

dict.string: On a cold day, evaporation will probably be
If ocean water evaporates, why don’t oceans disappear?

array.string: They are disappearing, but evaporation happens too slowly to detect|N
Water that evaporates is replaced with other water molecules|Y
Melting icebergs replace all of the evaporated water|N

dict.string: How does the Sun promote evaporation?

array.string: It supplies energy to water molecules|Y
It removes heat from the atmosphere|N

dict.string: If the Sun stopped shining, what would happen to Earth’s oceans?
What is a benefit of transpiration?

array.string: Water is returned to the atmosphere|N
Water molecules are filtered and cleaned through plants|N

dict.string: Which of the following is influenced by water vapor?
How does fracking impact the water cycle?

array.string: It reduces the rate of evaporation|N
It removes water from the water cycle|Y
It adds water to the water cycle|N

dict.string: Water has been found on Mars! Mars is colder than Earth. Which of the following is probably true?

array.string: Most water on Mars is vapor|N
Mars does not have a water cycle|N
Transpiration could not happen on Mars|N

dict.string: Which job can a cloud accomplish?

array.string: Shield the planet from solar rays|N
Prevent heat from escaping the atmosphere|N

dict.string: How does an airplane generally create a cloudy trail?

array.string: It burns a fuel that creates white smoke|N
It releases pollen and other particulates|N
It releases cold water vapor, which mixes with warm air|N
It releases warm water vapor, which mixes with cold air|Y

dict.string: Which idea best helps explain why sunglasses could become foggy?

array.string: The person wearing glasses is moving quickly|N
The person wearing glasses moved from cold air to warm air|Y

dict.string: One desert has clouds at night. One desert does not. What is most likely true?

array.string: The desert without clouds has no particulates|N
The cloudy desert is colder at night|N
The cloudy desert is warmer at night|Y
The deserts have the same temperature|N

dict.string: One cloud contains ice. Another cloud contains liquid water. Which of the following statements is most likely true?

array.string: The cloud with liquid water is above a desert|N
The cloud with ice crystals is above a desert|N
The cloud with liquid water is higher in the sky|N
The cloud with ice crystals is higher in the sky|Y

dict.string: According to the lesson, how can pollution from automobile traffic affect clouds?

array.string: Particulates from pollution can change the shape of clouds|N
Pollution can change the height of clouds|N
Pollution can prevent clouds from forming|N
Particulates from pollution can make cloud formation more likely|Y

dict.string: If evaporation sped up, how would it influence condensation?

array.string: Faster evaporation would not influence condensation|N
With faster evaporation there would be less chance for condensation|N
With faster evaporation there would be more chance for condensation|Y
All of the above are equally likely|N

dict.string: How is condensation similar to evaporation?

array.string: Both require the presence of particulates|N
Both are characterized by water molecules moving further apart|N
Both can only happen with pure water|N
Both involve water changing its state|Y

dict.string: Which of these events would make condensation more likely?
When condensation happens indoors, it can help mold and mildew grow. How can this be prevented?
Window A has condensation on the outside. Window B does not. Which window will keep the house warmer?
Which word best describes a cloud that is full?
What must happen for water to properly be called precipitation?

array.string: It must move from ocean to land|N
The likeliness of precipitation never changes|N

dict.string: Which role does precipitation play in the water cycle? Choose the best answer.

array.string: It deposits fresh water on Earth|Y
It removes carbon dioxide from water|N

dict.string: Fill in the blank. Acid rain _________________.
What triggers water to fall from a cloud? Choose the best answer.

array.string: Enough wind arrives to push the cloud|N

dict.string: Which of the following does not belong?
Why is the windy sign of a mountain usually the rainiest?

array.string: Temperatures are higher on the windy side|N
The windy side has a faster rate of evaporation|N
Wind moves up the mountain’s side and causes condensation|Y

dict.string: What can happen to a snowflake as it falls? Choose the best answer.

array.string: It can evaporate before it hits the ground|N
It can melt, refreeze and become sleet|N
It can fuse to water and become graupel|N

dict.string: Which is a way to classify precipitation?
Which action could best help to reduce acid rain?

array.string: Prohibit the dumping of oil into oceans|N
Require higher smokestacks on factories that pollute|N
Use solar power plants instead of coal power plants|Y

dict.string: Why might a cloud “unform” without precipitating?

array.string: A cold wind causes it to break|N

dict.string: Scientists have forced clouds to precipitate. Which strategy to force precipitation makes sense scientifically?

array.string: Inject a cloud with warm air|N
Inject a cloud with ice crystals|Y

dict.string: Sometimes silver iodide is used to force precipitation to occur. What would be a logical consequence?

array.string: More silver iodide is found in lakes|N
More silver iodide is found in plants|N
More silver iodide is found in animals|N

dict.string: Some parts of the world rarely have rain. What explains this best?

array.string: The condensation rate is faster than the evaporation rate|N
Condensation and evaporation are in balance|Y

dict.string: In the runoff stage of the water cycle, water moves primarily

array.string: from a liquid to solid form|N
from the ocean to the sky|N

dict.string: When water lands on the continents, how much of it enters a body of water right away?
What is a consequence of paving land with asphalt?

array.string: Water can’t return to the ocean|N

dict.string: What is a main cause of dead zones in the Gulf of Mexico?

array.string: They provide homes to rare species|N

dict.string: How do people make storms more dangerous?

array.string: They fill in wetlands to make land more firm|Y
They rotate crops to reduce erosion|N
They add water to the water cycle|N

dict.string: Why can ancient soil help prevent floods?

array.string: It contains a spongy layer of roots|Y

dict.string: Why doesn’t some water run off?

array.string: It pulls pollutants from the atmosphere and ground|N

dict.string: What is a consequence of runoff?

array.string: Water transpires at a faster rate|N
Water can’t return to the ocean|N
Less fertilizer is needed on farms|N

dict.string: How can water runoff from farms affect the ocean?

array.string: It can raise the ocean’s oxygen level|N
It cannot affect the ocean because the same amount of water always circulates|N
It can reduce the ocean’s evaporation rate|N
It can add pollutants to the ocean|Y

dict.string: How could runoff affect a farm? Choose the best answer

array.string: Land becomes polluted by factory waste|N

dict.string: How could communities help prevent farm runoff?

array.string: Remove fences and other barriers from around farms|N
Convert paved areas to their natural state|Y

dict.string: Which of the following could be created by runoff?
Which argument(s) would be appropriate to convince a local government to preserve their wetlands?

array.string: “You will help make storms less damaging”|N
“You will help prevent drought by restoring your water table”|N

dict.string: On an imaginary continent, where would a continental divide be the most likely?
